Sure, here is a sample three-day tour plan in Baoji, adopting the most economical and time-saving mode of transportation:

Day 1:
10:00 AM - 12:00 PM: Visit the Baoji Bronze Museum. You can take bus No. 1 or No. 5 from the city center to the museum. The journey takes about 30 minutes.
1:00 PM - 2:00 PM: Have lunch at a local restaurant. There are many restaurants near the museum that serve traditional Shaanxi cuisine.
2:00 PM - 4:00 PM: Visit People's Park. You can take bus No. 1 or No. 5 from the museum to the park. The journey takes about 15 minutes.
4:00 PM - 6:00 PM: Visit the Han Yangling Mausoleum. You can take bus No. K5 from the city center to the mausoleum. The journey takes about 45 minutes.
7:00 PM - 8:30 PM: Enjoy a traditional Shaanxi performance or show. There are many theaters and performance venues in Baoji that offer traditional Shaanxi music and dance performances. You can take the bus to reach the theater.

Day 2:
9:00 AM - 10:30 AM: Visit the Terracotta Warriors Museum. You can take bus No. K5 from the city center to the museum. The journey takes about 45 minutes.
11:00 AM - 12:00 PM: Visit the Han Great Wall Museum. You can take bus No. 1 or No. 5 from the museum to the museum. The journey takes about 15 minutes.
1:00 PM - 2:00 PM: Have lunch at a local restaurant.
2:00 PM - 4:00 PM: Visit the Qishan Mountain Scenic Area. You can take bus No. 11 or No. 16 from the city center to the scenic area. The journey takes about 45 minutes.

Day 3:
9:00 AM - 10:00 AM: Visit the Baoji Taoist Temple. You can take bus No. 5 or No. 11 from the city center to the temple. The journey takes about 30 minutes.
11:00 AM - 12:00 PM: Visit the Baoji Confucius Temple. You can take bus No. 5 or No. 11 from the temple to the temple. The journey takes about 15 minutes.
1:00 PM - 2:00 PM: Have lunch at a local restaurant.
2:00 PM - 4:00 PM: Visit the Baoji Museum of Han Stone Sculptures. You can take bus No. 1 from the city center to the museum. The journey takes about 30 minutes.

This plan assumes you will be taking a 2-hour lunch break each day, which is a common practice in China. The exact schedule can be adjusted based on your interests, energy levels, and other factors. You can also add or remove activities based on your preferences, or extend your visits at any of the destinations.

Please note that these are just suggestions and can be adjusted based on your specific needs and interests. Additionally, the opening and closing times of the attractions, the performance schedules, and the public transportation schedules may change, so it's best to check in advance or with your hotel to confirm.
